◆ datatable_sampling_task_delay()

esp_err_t datatable_sampling_task_delay ( datatable_handle_t datatable_handle)

Delays the data-table's sampling task until the next scheduled task event.
This function should be placed after the for (;;) { syntax to delay the task based on the configured time-into-interval handle interval type, period, and offset parameters.

Parameters
datatable_handleData-table handle.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ datatable_to_json()

esp_err_t datatable_to_json ( datatable_handle_t datatable_handle,
cJSON ** datatable )

Converts a data-table to a cJSON object.

cJSON data-table object output example;

{ "name": "1min_tbl", "process-interval": "minute", "process-period": 1, "columns": ["Record ID", "TS", "Pa_1-Min_Avg", "Ta_1-Min_Avg", "Ta_1-Min_Min", "Ta_1-Min_Max", "Hr_1-Min_Avg", "Td_1-Min_Avg", "Wd_1-Min_Avg", "Ws_1-Min_Avg"], "types": ["id", "ts", "float", "float", "float", "float", "int16", "float", "float", "float"], "processes": ["sample", "sample", "average", "average", "minimum", "maximum", "average", "average", "average", "average"], "rows": [ [1, 61684380120, 1001.3500366210938, 22.350000381469727, 22.340000152587891, 22.360000610351562, 51, 20.350000381469727, 210, 1.4500000476837158], [2, 61684380180, 1001.3533325195312, 22.35333251953125, 22.340000152587891, 22.360000610351562, 53, 20.353334426879883, 210, 1.4500000476837158], [3, 61684380240, 1001.3583374023438, 22.358335494995117, 22.350000381469727, 22.3700008392334, 55, 20.358333587646484, 210, 1.4500000476837158], [4, 61684380300, 1001.3417358398438, 22.341667175292969, 22.329999923706055, 22.350000381469727, 57, 20.341667175292969, 210, 1.4500000476837158]] }

Parameters
[in]datatable_handleData-table handle.
[out]datatableData-table as a cJSON object.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ ds18b20_detect()

esp_err_t ds18b20_detect ( onewire_bus_handle_t owb_handle,
onewire_device_t *const devices,
const uint8_t device_size,
uint8_t *const device_count )

Detects up to 10 DS18B20 devices on the 1-wire bus.

Parameters
[in]owb_handle1-wire bus handle.
[out]devicesArray of DS18B20 devices detected on the 1-wire bus.
[in]device_sizeSize of DS18B20 devices array. The maximum number of detectable DS18B20 devices is 10.
[out]device_countNumber of DS18B20 devices detected. The maximum number of detectable DS18B20 devices is 10.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ ds18b20_get_alarm_thresholds()

esp_err_t ds18b20_get_alarm_thresholds ( ds18b20_handle_t handle,
int8_t *const high,
int8_t *const low )

Reads high and low temperature alarm thresholds from DS18B20.

Parameters
handleDS18B20 device handle.
highDS18B20 high temperature alarm threshold setting (-55 to 125 degrees Celsius).
lowDS18B20 low temperature alarm threshold setting (-55 to 125 degrees Celsius).
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ ds18b20_get_fw_version()

const char * ds18b20_get_fw_version ( void )

Converts DS18B20 firmware version numbers (major, minor, patch) into a string.

Returns
char* DS18B20 firmware version as a string that is formatted as X.X.X (e.g. 4.0.0).

◆ ds18b20_get_fw_version_number()

int32_t ds18b20_get_fw_version_number ( void )

Converts DS18B20 firmware version numbers (major, minor, patch) into an integer value.

Returns
int32_t DS18B20 firmware version number.

◆ ds18b20_get_measurement()

esp_err_t ds18b20_get_measurement ( ds18b20_handle_t handle,
float *const temperature )

Reads temperature from DS18B20.

Note
The trigger temperature conversion function must be called before reading the temperature.
Parameters
handleDS18B20 device handle.
temperatureTemperature in degree Celsius.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ ds18b20_get_power_supply_mode()

esp_err_t ds18b20_get_power_supply_mode ( ds18b20_handle_t handle,
bool *const parasitic )

Reads power supply mode setting from DS18B20. Parasitic-powered devices are powered by the data pin (DQ) and will pull the bus low during read time slot. Parasitic-powered devices are not supported at this time.

Parameters
handleDS18B20 device handle.
parasiticDS18B20 power supply mode setting is parasitic when true.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ ds18b20_get_resolution()

esp_err_t ds18b20_get_resolution ( ds18b20_handle_t handle,

Reads temperature conversion resolution from DS18B20.

Parameters

resolutionDS18B20 temperature conversion resolution setting.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ ds18b20_get_temperature()

◆ ds18b20_init()

esp_err_t ds18b20_init ( onewire_device_t * device,
const ds18b20_config_t * ds18b20_config,
ds18b20_handle_t * ds18b20_handle )

Initializes an DS18B20 device onto the 1-wire master bus.

Note
Parasitic-powered devices are not supported at this time.
Parameters
[in]device1-wire device.
[in]ds18b20_configDS18B20 device configuration.
[out]ds18b20_handleDS18B20 device handle.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ ds18b20_set_alarm_thresholds()

esp_err_t ds18b20_set_alarm_thresholds ( ds18b20_handle_t handle,
const int8_t high,
const int8_t low )

Writes high and low temperature alarm thresholds to DS18B20.

Parameters
handleDS18B20 device handle.
highDS18B20 high temperature alarm threshold setting (-55 to 125 degrees Celsius).
lowDS18B20 low temperature alarm threshold setting (-55 to 125 degrees Celsius).
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ ds18b20_trigger_temperature_conversion()

esp_err_t ds18b20_trigger_temperature_conversion ( ds18b20_handle_t handle)

Triggers DS18B20 temperature conversion. This function must be called before reading the temperature from DS18B20.

Parameters
handleDS18B20 device handle.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ ens160_enable_deep_sleep_mode()

esp_err_t ens160_enable_deep_sleep_mode ( ens160_handle_t handle)

Enables deep sleep operating mode to ENS160.

Note
The ENS160 will not respond to commands unless it is placed in idle or operational mode.
Parameters
[in]handleENS160 device handle.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ ens160_enable_idle_mode()

Parameters
[in]handleENS160 device handle.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ ina226_reset()

esp_err_t ina226_reset ( ina226_handle_t handle)

Resets the INA226.

Same as power-on reset. Resets all registers to default values. Calibration is conducted automatically after reset.

Parameters
[in]handleINA226 device handle
Returns
ESP_OK on success.

◆ ltr390uv_get_power_status()

esp_err_t ltr390uv_get_power_status ( ltr390uv_handle_t handle,
bool *const power_on )

Reads power status flag from LTR390UV. This flag is cleared after the register is read.

Parameters
handleLTR390UV device handle.
[out]power_onLTR390UV is power on event when true and all interrupt threshold settings in the registers have been reset to power on default state.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ ltr390uv_get_status()

esp_err_t ltr390uv_get_status ( ltr390uv_handle_t handle,
bool *const data_ready,
bool *const power_on,
bool *const interrupt )

Reads interrupt status flags from LTR390UV. The flags are cleared after the register is read.

Parameters
handleLTR390UV device handle.
data_readyLTR390UV data is new and ready to read when true.
power_onLTR390UV is power on event when true and all interrupt threshold settings in the registers have been reset to power on default state.
interruptLTR390UV interrupt is active when true.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ ltr390uv_get_status_register()

esp_err_t ltr390uv_get_status_register ( ltr390uv_handle_t handle,
ltr390uv_status_register_t *const reg )

Parameters
handleLTR390UV device handle.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ ltr390uv_get_thresholds()

esp_err_t ltr390uv_get_thresholds ( ltr390uv_handle_t handle,
uint32_t *const lower_threshold,
uint32_t *const upper_threshold )

Reads UVS/ALS lower and upper thresholds from LTR390UV. The thresholds are used to trigger an interrupt when the light level exceeds the upper threshold or falls below the lower threshold.

Parameters
handleLTR390UV device handle.
lower_thresholdLTR390UV lower threshold in lux or mW/cm^2 setting.
upper_thresholdLTR390UV upper threshold in lux or mW/cm^2 setting.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ ltr390uv_get_ultraviolet_index()

esp_err_t ltr390uv_get_ultraviolet_index ( ltr390uv_handle_t handle,
float *const ultraviolet_index )

Reads ultraviolet index (UVI) from LTR390UV.

Parameters
handleLTR390UV device handle.
ultraviolet_indexUltraviolet index (UVI).
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ ltr390uv_get_uvs()

Reads UVS sensor counts from LTR390UV.

Parameters
handleLTR390UV device handle.
sensor_countsUltraviolet light in mW/cm^2.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

red_countRed LED ADC count.
ir_countIR LED ADC count.
green_countGreen LED ADC count.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ max30105_init()

◆ mmc56x3_convert_to_heading()

Parameters

◆ mmc56x3_convert_to_true_heading()

Parameters
declinationMMC56X3 magnetic declination angle in degrees (http://www.magnetic-declination.com/) setting.

Returns
float True heading in degrees.

◆ mmc56x3_set_selftest_thresholds()

esp_err_t mmc56x3_set_selftest_thresholds ( mmc56x3_handle_t handle,
const mmc56x3_selftest_axes_data_t axes_data )

Writes axes configuration to MMC56X3 to enable or disable axes (x, y, z), axes are enabled by default.

Parameters
handleMMC56X3 device handle.
x_axis_disabledX-axis is enabled by default, set to true to disable x-axis.
y_axis_disabledY-axis is enabled by default, set to true to disable y-axis.
z_axis_disabledY-axis is enabled by default, set to true to disable z-axis.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

Writes self-test axes data thresholds to MMC56X3.

Parameters
handleMMC56X3 device handle.
axes_dataMMC56X3 axes data thresholds setting.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

Note

◆ mpu6050_reset()

Issues soft-reset to MPU6050 and initializes MPU6050 device handle registers. However, device configuration registers must be configured before reading data registers.

Parameters
handleMPU6050 device handle.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ mpu6050_set_sample_rate_divider_register()

esp_err_t mpu6050_set_sample_rate_divider_register ( mpu6050_handle_t handle,
const uint8_t reg )

Writes sample rate divider register to MPU6050.

Note
The Sample Rate is generated by dividing the gyroscope output rate by SMPLRT_DIV:
Sample Rate = Gyroscope Output Rate / (1 + SMPLRT_DIV) where Gyroscope Output Rate = 8kHz when the DLPF is disabled (DLPF_CFG = 0 or 7), and 1kHz when the DLPF is enabled (see Register 26).
Parameters
[in]handleMPU6050 device handle.
[in]regMPU6050 sample rate divider value.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

sample rate = gyroscope output rate / (1 + sample rate divider) 8khz or 1khz

◆ mpu6050_set_signal_path_reset_register()

esp_err_t mpu6050_set_signal_path_reset_register ( mpu6050_handle_t handle,

◆ ods18b20_validate_address()

bool ods18b20_validate_address ( const onewire_device_address_t address)

Checks 1-wire device address against the ROM ID (i.e. family code of DS18B20 is 0x28) to determine if the device is a DS18B20.

Parameters
address1-wire device address.
Returns
bool 1-wire device is a DS18B20 when true;

◆ sgp4x_delete()

esp_err_t sgp4x_delete ( sgp4x_handle_t handle)

Removes an SGP4X device from master bus and frees handle.

Parameters
[in]handleSGP4X device handle.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ sgp4x_execute_compensated_conditioning()

esp_err_t sgp4x_execute_compensated_conditioning ( sgp4x_handle_t handle,
const float temperature,
const float humidity,
uint16_t * sraw_voc )

Starts the conditioning with temperature and humidity compensation, i.e., the VOC pixel will be operated at the same temperature as it is by calling the sgp41_measure_raw_signals function while the NOx pixel will be operated at a different temperature for conditioning. The conditioning should be ran when the device is initially powered for 10-seconds but do not run the conditioning longer than 10-seconds, otherwise damage may occur to the SGP4X.

Parameters
[in]handleSGP4X device handle.
[in]temperatureTemperature compensation in degree celcius.
[in]humidityHumidity compensation in percentage.
[out]sraw_vocRaw signal of VOC in ticks which is proportional to the logarithm of the resistance of the sensing element.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ sgp4x_execute_conditioning()

esp_err_t sgp4x_execute_conditioning ( sgp4x_handle_t handle,
uint16_t * sraw_voc )

Starts the conditioning, i.e., the VOC pixel will be operated at the same temperature as it is by calling the sgp41_measure_raw_signals function while the NOx pixel will be operated at a different temperature for conditioning. The conditioning should be ran when the device is initially powered for 10-seconds but do not run the conditioning longer than 10-seconds, otherwise damage may occur to the SGP4X.

Parameters
[in]handleSGP4X device handle.
[out]sraw_vocRaw signal of VOC in ticks which is proportional to the logarithm of the resistance of the sensing element.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ sgp4x_execute_self_test()

esp_err_t sgp4x_execute_self_test ( sgp4x_handle_t handle,
sgp4x_self_test_result_t *const result )

Performs the built-in self-test that checks for integrity of both hotplate and MOX material.

Parameters
[in]handleSGP4X device handle.
[out]resultResults of the self-tests.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ sgp4x_measure_compensated_signals()

esp_err_t sgp4x_measure_compensated_signals ( sgp4x_handle_t handle,
const float temperature,
const float humidity,
uint16_t * sraw_voc,
uint16_t * sraw_nox )

Starts and/or continues the VOC and NOX measurement mode with temperature and humidity compensation.

Parameters
[in]handleSGP4X device handle.
[in]temperatureTemperature compensation in degree Celsius.
[in]humidityHumidity compensation in percentage.
[out]sraw_vocRaw signal of VOC in ticks which is proportional to the logarithm of the resistance of the sensing element.
[out]sraw_noxRaw signal of NOX in ticks which is proportional to the logarithm of the resistance of the sensing element.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ sgp4x_measure_signals()

esp_err_t sgp4x_measure_signals ( sgp4x_handle_t handle,
uint16_t * sraw_voc,
uint16_t * sraw_nox )

Starts and/or continues the VOC and NOX measurement mode using default temperature and humidity compensation.

Parameters
[in]handleSGP4X device handle.
[out]sraw_vocRaw signal of VOC in ticks which is proportional to the logarithm of the resistance of the sensing element.
[out]sraw_noxRaw signal of NOX in ticks which is proportional to the logarithm of the resistance of the sensing element.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

Returns
char* SHT4X firmware version as a string that is formatted as X.X.X (e.g. 4.0.0).

◆ sht4x_get_fw_version_number()

int32_t sht4x_get_fw_version_number ( void )

Converts SHT4X firmware version numbers (major, minor, patch) into an integer value.

Returns
int32_t SHT4X firmware version number.

◆ sht4x_get_heater_mode()

esp_err_t sht4x_get_heater_mode ( sht4x_handle_t handle,
sht4x_heater_modes_t *const mode )

Reads measurement heater mode setting from SHT4X.

Parameters
handleSHT4X device handle.
modeHeater mode setting.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ sht4x_get_measurement()

esp_err_t sht4x_get_measurement ( sht4x_handle_t handle,
float *const temperature,
float *const humidity )

Reads high-level measurements from SHT4X. This is a blocking function.

Note
The function delays the calling task up to 1.1 s to wait for the measurement results. This might lead to problems when the function is called from a software timer callback function.
Parameters
[in]handleSHT4X device handle.
[out]temperatureTemperature in degree Celsius.
[out]humidityRelative humidity in percentage.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ sht4x_get_measurements()

esp_err_t sht4x_get_measurements ( sht4x_handle_t handle,
float *const temperature,
float *const humidity,
float *const dewpoint )

Similar to i2c_sht4x_read_measurement but it includes the dewpoint temperature in the results.

Parameters
[in]handleSHT4X device handle.
[out]temperatureTemperature in degree Celsius.
[out]humidityRelative humidity in percentage.
[out]dewpointCalculated dewpoint temperature in degree Celsius.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ ssd1306_display_textbox_banner()

esp_err_t ssd1306_display_textbox_banner ( ssd1306_handle_t handle,
uint8_t page,
uint8_t segment,
const char * text,
uint8_t box_width,
bool invert,
uint8_t delay )

Displays scrolling text within a box as banner by page and segment on the SSD1306 with a maximum of 100-characters.

Parameters
handleSSD1306 device handle.
pageIndex of page.
segIndex of segment data.
textText characters (100 characters maximum) to display.
box_widthWidth of the box.
invertText is inverted when true.
delayDelay in milliseconds before information is displayed, a value 0 there is no wait.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ ssd1306_display_textbox_ticker()

uint8_t box_width,

uint8_t delay )

Displays scrolling text within a box as a ticker by page and segment on the SSD1306 with a maximum of 100-characters.

Parameters
handleSSD1306 device handle.
pageIndex of page.
segIndex of segment data.
textText characters (100 characters maximum) to display.
box_widthWidth of the box.
invertText is inverted when true.
delayDelay in milliseconds before information is displayed, a value 0 there is no wait.
Returns

◆ ssd1306_display_wrap_around()

esp_err_t ssd1306_display_wrap_around ( ssd1306_handle_t handle,
ssd1306_scroll_types_t scroll,
uint8_t start,
uint8_t end,
int8_t delay )

Sets SSD1306 scroll orientation, start and end pages to wrap around the display.

Parameters
handleSSD1306 device handle.
scrollScrolling orientation.
startIndex of page for left or right scroll, otherwise, height position for up or down scroll.
endIndex of page for left or right scroll, otherwise, height position for up or down scroll.
delayDelay in milliseconds (0-255) before information is displayed, a value 0 there is no wait, and nothing is displayed with a value of -1.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

int32_t TBI2CXXX firmware version number.

◆ tbi2cxxx_get_object_temperature()

float *const temperature )

Reads object temperature from TBI2CXXX.

Parameters

temperatureObject temperature in degrees celsius.

◆ tbi2cxxx_set_emissivity()

esp_err_t tbi2cxxx_set_emissivity ( tbi2cxxx_handle_t handle,
const float coefficient )

Writes emissivity coefficient setting to TBI2CXXX.

Note
The manufacturer recommends restarting the sensor by cycling power off and on.
Parameters
handleTBI2CXXX device handle.
coefficientTBI2CXXX emissivity coefficient setting, acceptable range is 0.1 to 1.0.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ veml7700_get_ambient_light()

Reads ambient light (0 lux to 140 klux) from VEML7700.

Note
This follows the official Vishay VEML7700 Application Note, rev. 17-Jan-2024.

[out]ambient_lightAmbient light illumination in lux.

esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.

◆ veml7700_get_ambient_light_auto()

esp_err_t veml7700_get_ambient_light_auto ( veml7700_handle_t handle,
float *const ambient_light )

Reads optimal ambient light (0 lux to 140 klux) from VEML7700.

Note
This follows the official Vishay VEML7700 Application Note, rev. 17-Jan-2024.
This doesn't seem to work all the time, results can vary, more testing required.
Parameters
[in]handleVEML7700 device handle.
[out]ambient_lightAmbient light illumination in lux.
Returns
esp_err_t ESP_OK on success.
